Sequence Information.Peptide Name: IR2 (Ile-rich; Arg-rich; synthetic AMPs, XXA, 1S=S, UCSS1; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (50%) toProtegrin 2R: 50%; I: 29%; C: 14%.  GRAVY: -0.41; M Wt: 1917.438; Mol formula:  C81H149N35O15S2; molar extinction coeff: 125.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 1 uM), S. Pullorum C79-13 (MIC 1 uM), S. enterica serovar Typhimurium C77-31 (MIC 4 uM), B. yocyaneum ATCC 27853 (MIC 4 uM), Gram+ S. aeurus ATCC 29213 (MIC 4 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 4 uM),  S. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 4 uM), and B. subtilis CMCC 63501 (MIC 2 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM salt); KCl-sensitized:E. coli (4.5 mM salt), NH4Cl-sensitized:E. coli (6 uM salt), MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM salt), CaCl2-insensitive:E. coli (2.5 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 uM salt), FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM salt); NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (4.5 mM salt), NH4Cl-sensitized:S. aureus (6 uM salt), MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (1 mM salt), CaCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (2.5 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM salt), FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (4 uM salt).Toxicity: 128 uM peptide caused 10% hemolysis, very low hemo.lytic Provided by Arjun Nair.
Literature Information.Author: Dong N, Zhu X, Chou S, Shan A, Li W, Jiang J.2014
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial potency and selectivity of simplified symmetric-end peptides.
